p: The TTASS based on the CARIFS questionnaire was similar between treatment groups, with a median of 138.1 [95% confidence interval (CI): 116.6–163.2] hours for baloxavir and 150.0 (95% CI: 115.0–165.7) hours for oseltamivir (Fig. 2 and Table 3). For children infected with H3N2, median TTASS was similar between the baloxavir and oseltamivir groups, while for those infected with H1N1pdm09, TTASS was numerically lower for baloxavir than oseltamivir; Table 3). The number of children with influenza B was too low to allow meaningful interpretation of the data.
